intro: Cherleria obtusiloba, commonly known as the blunt-leaf cherleria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with a blunt tip. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
